job_title: High Pressure Material Science - Research Scientist
job_text: ['', ' PhD in physics, chemistry or a related field, or the equivalent combination of education and related experience. Significant experience with pulsed and ultrafast laser systems including data analysis/reduction, and interpretation of results. Ability as an innovative experimentalist with experience in experimental design, techniques, and execution. Advanced quantitative analytical capability. Record of accomplishments demonstrating scientific leadership, ability to establish an independent research program and to carry out world-class research. Decision-making skills necessary to independently solve problems plus the advanced interpersonal skills necessary to interact with a diverse set of scientists, engineers, and other technical and administrative staff within a collaborative research environment. Advanced written and verbal communication skills necessary to deliver presentations and prepare written reports, explain technical information, and provide advice to management. Recent record of peer-reviewed publications.', 'Security Clearance: ', ' Programming skills in LabView, MatLab, and Mathematica.', ' Publish research results in peer-reviewed scientific or technical journals and present results at external conferences, seminars and/or technical meetings.', 'Work by Glassdoor!', ' Decision-making skills necessary to independently solve problems plus the advanced interpersonal skills necessary to interact with a diverse set of scientists, engineers, and other technical and administrative staff within a collaborative research environment.', ' Perform complex experimental work and laboratory experiments to obtain reactant and product equations of state related to explosives and metals, phase diagrams, and optical spectroscopy including IR absorption, Raman, and pyrometry, under static (diamond anvil cell) compression to GPa pressures and/or 10-3500 Kelvin (via laser or electrical heating).', ' Experience using diamond-anvil cell (DAC) technology. Programming skills in LabView, MatLab, and Mathematica. Experience with DAC X-ray synchrotron experiments and data analysis.', ' Participate in collaborative efforts with other national laboratories and industry.', ' Participate in external reviews of projects at the request of DOE.', ' PhD in physics, chemistry or a related field, or the equivalent combination of education and related experience.', ' Advanced written and verbal communication skills necessary to deliver presentations and prepare written reports, explain technical information, and provide advice to management.', 'Desired Qualifications', ' Develop and present written analyses and verbal briefings that capture and communicate research results as well as periodic progress reports.', ' Significant experience with pulsed and ultrafast laser systems including data analysis/reduction, and interpretation of results.', 'Essential Duties', ' Record of accomplishments demonstrating scientific leadership, ability to establish an independent research program and to carry out world-class research.', ' Recent record of peer-reviewed publications.', ' Advanced quantitative analytical capability.', 'Pre-Employment Drug Test:', ' Ability as an innovative experimentalist with experience in experimental design, techniques, and execution.', ' Experience using diamond-anvil cell (DAC) technology.', ' Experience with DAC X-ray synchrotron experiments and data analysis.', 'Join us and make YOUR mark on the World!', 'Note: ', ' Contribute to the conception, design, and execution of advanced research.', 'Qualifications', ' Perform other duties as assigned.', ' Prepare samples and conduct laser and/or x-ray based measurements.', ' Prepare samples and conduct laser and/or x-ray based measurements. Perform complex experimental work and laboratory experiments to obtain reactant and product equations of state related to explosives and metals, phase diagrams, and optical spectroscopy including IR absorption, Raman, and pyrometry, under static (diamond anvil cell) compression to GPa pressures and/or 10-3500 Kelvin (via laser or electrical heating). Contribute to the conception, design, and execution of advanced research. Participate in collaborative efforts with other national laboratories and industry. Participate in external reviews of projects at the request of DOE. Develop and present written analyses and verbal briefings that capture and communicate research results as well as periodic progress reports. Publish research results in peer-reviewed scientific or technical journals and present results at external conferences, seminars and/or technical meetings. Perform other duties as assigned.', 'About Us', '2020 Best Places to ']

['', 'Disclaimer', 'Capgemini is committed to building a workforce of employees with diverse backgrounds and work experiences. We strongly encourage women, veterans and active military service personnel to apply.\xa0\xa0', 'This is a general description of the Duties, Responsibilities and Qualifications required for this position. Physical, mental, sensory or environmental demands may be referenced in an attempt to communicate the manner in which this position traditionally is performed. Whenever necessary to provide individuals with disabilities an equal employment opportunity, Capgemini will consider reasonable accommodations that might involve varying job requirements and/or changing the way this job is performed, provided that such accommodations do not pose an undue hardship.\xa0\xa0', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Should be a quick learner and have worked on similar new tech stack Dremio Dataiku ', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Must possess experience working on Python ', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Knowledge of Talend Big Data or similar ETL tools ', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Should possess knowledge of process automation ', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Should possess solid experience working with modern data landscape', '\xa0', 'Our Shared values have been at the heart of the group since our formation. They are honesty, boldness, trust, freedom, team spirit, modesty and fun. These values influence the way we meet client needs while respecting the regulatory requirements of each country in which we operate, and the way we promote ethically sound practices within Capgemini and in our partnerships.\xa0\xa0', 'Your career matters to you and is important to us too. Because your goals and needs are constantly evolving, we offer visibility, leeway and support to help you grow and progress in your career. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company of 270,000 team members in almost 50\u202fcountries. We believe working with talented individuals from different backgrounds and points of view is a strategic advantage and an ongoing opportunity. Diversity enriches our creative solutions and adds value for our clients.\xa0\xa0', ' Location – Hartford, CT', 'Title – Senior Data Engineer', 'Capgemini is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. ['Experience working with high-performance computing clusters, especially ones designed for AI/machine learning applications, such as AWS ', 'Highly proficient in programming and scripting in at least one language (R, Python, Julia, etc.) ', 'Identify novel indications or side effects for drugs prescribed to patients in certain settings, in order to recommend strategies to improve standard of care. ', 'Familiarity with Common Data Models, such as OMOP CDM from OHDSI, is an advantage ', 'Knowledge of advanced machine learning methodologies such as deep learning, computer vision on radiology or pathology images, and natural language processing ', 'Build machine learning and deep learning pipelines to assess risk for a number of diseases using integrated big data from various data sources, including genetics, genomics, electronic medical records, social, behavioral, and environmental information, wearable data, and medical imaging data. ', 'Work with the Business Development team, which collaborates with pharmaceutical and insurance partners, to use aggregated patient data to assess a variety of clinical questions. ', ' ', 'RESPONSIBILITIES ', 'Standardize and normalize data extracted from electronic medical records using Common Data Models, such as OMOP, RxNorm, LOINC, and CCS. ', 'Data Scientists', 'Extensive experience in machine learning with a proven track record of developing and applying advanced computational techniques to solve complex disease problems Knowledge of advanced machine learning methodologies such as deep learning, computer vision on radiology or pathology images, and natural language processing Experience working with high-performance computing clusters, especially ones designed for AI/machine learning applications, such as AWS Familiarity with Common Data Models, such as OMOP CDM from OHDSI, is an advantage Highly proficient in programming and scripting in at least one language (R, Python, Julia, etc.) Experience with SQL and Oracle databases', 'QUALIFICATIONS ', 'Build machine learning and deep learning pipelines to assess risk for a number of diseases using integrated big data from various data sources, including genetics, genomics, electronic medical records, social, behavioral, and environmental information, wearable data, and medical imaging data. Standardize and normalize data extracted from electronic medical records using Common Data Models, such as OMOP, RxNorm, LOINC, and CCS. Identify novel indications or side effects for drugs prescribed to patients in certain settings, in order to recommend strategies to improve standard of care. Work with the Business Development team, which collaborates with pharmaceutical and insurance partners, to use aggregated patient data to assess a variety of clinical questions. ', 'Experience with SQL and Oracle databases', 'Extensive experience in machine learning with a proven track record of developing and applying advanced computational techniques to solve complex disease problems ', 'QUALIFICATIONS', 'Our clients are seeking Data Scientists\xa0to join their team. An ideal candidate would be someone who is interested in developing and implementing novel approaches in translational medicine, or applying analytic and interpretive methods to integrate a wide variety of health and genomic data and leverage it towards improving treatment and prevention. ', 'RESPONSIBILITIES']

['', 'Prepare written documents such as standard operating procedures, memos, reports, and technology transfer documentation', 'Position Requirements', 'Duties Include, But Are Not Limited To The Following', 'Run day to day skin biology lab operations', 'Ability to perform various tests and modify techniques where required for a range of biological actives, chemicals, formulations, and dosage forms', 'MS or Ph.D. in biology, physiology, biochemistry, pharmacy, or medicine with 5+ years of experience (academia and industry) related to safety & efficacy lab methods development in skin biology', 'Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills', 'Understanding of cosmetic and pharmaceutical regulations (FDA, OECD), industry guidance, and GMP practices is preferred', 'Adhere to scientifically-sound practices, including both model-based and risk-based approaches to research, design, development, scale-up, and technology transfers of formulations, methods, and processes', 'Evaluate instruments, equipment, processes, and systems to improve safety, quality, and performance', 'Experience in managing contract research organizations (CROs) and testing labs preferred', 'Perform extensive bench-lab cell- and tissue-based biology assays for safety and efficacy towards emerging skin concerns. Communicate technical information to internal teams and/or external clients (CROs, testing labs) in the form of oral and written correspondence, presentations, and reports', 'Support products throughout clinical development and/or commercial manufacturing activities', 'Work successfully in a fast-paced, dynamic, highly collaborative, scientifically driven, team-oriented, and customer-focused environment inclusive of research', 'Create skin biology internal capability for safety and efficacy studies on novel cosmetic ingredients', 'Design, execute, review, and interpret experiments to provide recommendations toward the product development strategy', 'Ability to direct activities of a team toward time-sensitive deliverables', 'Proven technical skills in problem solving, analytical techniques, data gathering, analysis, statistics, interpretation, and proficiency in method and instrument troubleshooting', ' Create skin biology internal capability for safety and efficacy studies on novel cosmetic ingredients Design, execute, review, and interpret experiments to provide recommendations toward the product development strategy Apply knowledge of skin biology, physiology, toxicology, and biochemistry to solve challenges around: safety & toxicology, skin physiological pathways, transdermal penetration and drug delivery, formulation, analytics, and manufacturing Adhere to scientifically-sound practices, including both model-based and risk-based approaches to research, design, development, scale-up, and technology transfers of formulations, methods, and processes Perform extensive bench-lab cell- and tissue-based biology assays for safety and efficacy towards emerging skin concerns. Communicate technical information to internal teams and/or external clients (CROs, testing labs) in the form of oral and written correspondence, presentations, and reports Support products throughout clinical development and/or commercial manufacturing activities Prepare written documents such as standard operating procedures, memos, reports, and technology transfer documentation Evaluate instruments, equipment, processes, and systems to improve safety, quality, and performance Run day to day skin biology lab operations ', ' MS or Ph.D. in biology, physiology, biochemistry, pharmacy, or medicine with 5+ years of experience (academia and industry) related to safety & efficacy lab methods development in skin biology Proven technical skills in problem solving, analytical techniques, data gathering, analysis, statistics, interpretation, and proficiency in method and instrument troubleshooting Ability to perform various tests and modify techniques where required for a range of biological actives, chemicals, formulations, and dosage forms Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills Ability to direct activities of a team toward time-sensitive deliverables Work successfully in a fast-paced, dynamic, highly collaborative, scientifically driven, team-oriented, and customer-focused environment inclusive of research Understanding of cosmetic and pharmaceutical regulations (FDA, OECD), industry guidance, and GMP practices is preferred Experience in managing contract research organizations (CROs) and testing labs preferred ', 'Apply knowledge of skin biology, physiology, toxicology, and biochemistry to solve challenges around: safety & toxicology, skin physiological pathways, transdermal penetration and drug delivery, formulation, analytics, and manufacturing', 'Founded in 2013 and based in the San Francisco Bay Area, Zymergen is a technology company unlocking the power of biology. We deliver better economics for products made from biology that are used across industries, bring new products to market faster, and develop novel products. Our proprietary platform uses robots and machine learning to engineer microbes faster, more predictably, and to a level of performance previously unattainable. These microbes, and the products they produce, have broad applications across industries such as chemicals and materials, agriculture, and healthcare. For more information visit www.zymergen.com.']

['', 'We are nonprofit in need of someone with experience in market research to assist us with collecting data on the impact of COVID-19 on small healthcare practices accross the country. This is a great opportunity to be a part of the COVID-19 recovery efforts. It is a volunteer position that would require no more than 10 hours a week and can be done remotely.', '-Finding the clinics/practices that are in most need of our assistance', 'About the organization:', '-Providing insights on the best methods of market research', 'We appreciate any help we can get!', 'HSRE is a start-up Nonprofit organization founded in response to the financial impact of COVID-19 on the healthcare industry. The purpose of the Healthcare Sustainability and Relief Effort is to provide resources in the form of healthcare business consulting services, educational material, and financial assistance to small healthcare organizations of all specialties with 30 employees or less focusing first in Washington State impacted by COVID-19 so that they may reopen and continue to provide necessary patient care following the lifting of the statewide lockdown. HSRE is committed to creating personalized and actionable solutions for each business to implement with the goal of ensuring a strong foundation on which each healthcare practice or facility can regrow and sustain business.', '-Designing and sending out surveys to collect data', '-Anayzing and interpreting the data', 'It would consist of:']

job_text: ['*There is no travel during COVID-19 and next to no travel in the future*\xa0', '\xa0 ', ' Senior Consultant- Data Analytics/Engineering ', 'My client is a boutique strategy consulting group that focuses exclusively on the telecommunications, media, and technology (TMT) related sectors. They assist clients in fast, high-impact, confident decision making, enabling them to seize new opportunities, improve performance, and increase shareholder value. They also do a lot of work with Private Equity firms.  \xa0 They are looking for a Senior Consultant- Data Analytics/Engineering to join their internal analytics technology group that is focused on developing a suite of advanced analytics products and supporting business strategy consulting teams. ['', 'Experience with Radar, LiDAR, computer vision, sensor fusion, probabilistic perception, point cloud processing, object tracking, data association, optimization, and/or machine learning is a plus.', 'Flexible and creative thinking.', 'Experience with MATLAB.', "What You'll Do:", 'About Us\xa0', 'Develop perception algorithms to detect and identify objects, etc. for autonomous driving systems.', 'Experience with mathematical modeling.', 'Master’s or Ph.D. degree in Robotics, ECE, Computer Science, or a related field.', 'Experience with simulation environments', 'Partner with colleagues to design innovative algorithms in motion planning, and control.', 'Motional is making driverless vehicles a safe, reliable, and accessible reality.\xa0', 'Collect data and analyze the results of benchmarks, road, and regression tests.', 'Develop perception algorithms to detect and identify objects, etc. for autonomous driving systems.Collect data and analyze the results of benchmarks, road, and regression tests.Partner with colleagues to design innovative algorithms in motion planning, and control.Integrate perception software into prototype autonomous driving systems.', 'Do you enjoy working with prototypes? The Motional team is behind some of the industry’s largest leaps forward in the last decade, including the first fully-autonomous cross-country drive in the U.S, the launch of the world’s first robotaxi pilot, and operation of the world’s most-established public robotaxi fleet. Strategically formed by Hyundai Motor Group, one of the world’s largest vehicle manufacturers offering smart mobility solutions, and Aptiv, a global technology leader in advanced safety, electrification, and vehicle connectivity, Motional is fundamentally changing how people move through their lives.\xa0', '5+ years of experience in C++, Python or other programming languages.', 'Strong communication and interpersonal skills.', 'Our Perception Research Scientists play a key role in making the vehicle of the future a reality by developing technologies that deliver a turnkey, fully autonomous driving system for our customers, and enable Mobility on Demand (MoD). Your job will be to help our designers solve problems, and find opportunities, validate concepts, and refine them. For the Workplace group, that means building products and solutions that help employers maximize the value of their workplace retirement plans and put individuals on the path to better retirement outcomes. Workplace is a high-growth area for Morningstar that houses a diverse suite of technology and investment-based solutions. Our unique client base includes retirement plan providers, plan sponsors, plan consultants, and retirement plan advisors. By constantly evolving our solutions and solving our clients’ problems, we are well-positioned to help individuals achieve a better retirement. ['', 'You will be responsible for solving business problems with real-world data working closely with Product, Engineering, and Client Success teams across the company, from defining the product roadmap and business problems to delivering the product. ', 'Opportunity to work with an award-winning organization in the hottest space in tech -artificial intelligence and advanced machine learning. Today, regulatory compliance processes have become more complex and fluidic, increasing the chances for rule-based models to fail.\xa0\xa0', 'Any US location', 'PHD required', 'Requires experience in Python and Spark, the ability to execute research plans using machine learning technologies, knowledge of NLP, graph database and graph algorithms would be a plus. ', 'Voted as one of the top 21 AI start-ups focusing on the financial services sector. ', 'Flexible working hours - everything is results-oriented. Strong compensation. Will consider recent PHD’s with solid training.', 'My client provides machine learning-powered enterprise solutions to address these regulatory compliance problems in the financial services sector. ', 'They won several awards for their approach to make the workflows in AML and Reconciliation scalable and highly auditable. ']

['Commitment Level:', "Must Haves:• 3+ years' experience in user experience research, HCI, information systems, psychology or related social science field• 3+ years’ experience in applied product or usability research• Must be proficient in Qualitative research (end to end-user research) and familiar with Quantitative research as well.• Familiarity with remote qualitative research data collection tools and analysis software required• Familiarity with statistical data analysis tools preferred• Expertise in conducting research using a wide variety of qualitative methods, including in-depth interviews, participatory design, and usability• Patient, communicative, team player that is detail-oriented and has outstanding interpersonal skills ", 'Hours & Location:M-F, 40 hours/week. This role will be remote while COVID restrictions are in place. The expectation is to be onsite at our Customer’s Menlo Park, CA location once it is deemed safe to do so. ', 'Opportunity:', ' ', 'Now for the Perks!• Health Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life (including spouse & child), 401k, STD/LTD, AD&D, and Commuter Benefits program)• Accrued PTO: Up to 15 days per 12 months on assignment• New Child Benefit: Up to $4,000 for the birth or adoption of a child while on assignment (conditions apply)', 'Company Industry:\xa0 TechnologyOpportunity: The Mom Project is helping to source candidates for the above client who is looking for a\xa0UX Researcher - QualitativeCommitment Level:\xa040 hours per week, on-site, contract through March 2021 ', 'We are seeking UX Researcher on a contract basis to join a diverse and collaborative team of researchers who work directly with a broad set of product stakeholders to make the best social platform to empower people to build safe communities and connect with one another. Our work ranges from formative to evaluative, ethnography to usability. For this position, we are looking for a skilled qualitative user experience researcher to contribute research to support our Community Services Incubator product teams. ', "Education:• Candidates with a Bachelor's degree must have at least 5 years working in the field.• Candidates with a Master's degree must have at least 3 years working in the field. ", 'Our Customer’s mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through their family of apps and services, they are building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. ', 'This role involves getting up to speed on innovative 0 to 1 product spaces, collaborating with researchers and cross-functional stakeholders to identify research topics, executing end-to-end qualitative and/or quantitative research studies, and communicating results and product recommendations broadly and effectively. The successful candidate will be comfortable in a fast-moving organization, excited to collaborate, a great communicator and researcher, and focused squarely on impacting the design of new products. ', 'What you’ll do:• Work closely with multiple product teams to identify and prioritize topics for both tactical and foundational research• Work cross-functionally with research, design, product management, content strategy, data science, engineering, and marketing to share research findings and make product recommendations• Design usability studies and moderate interviews that address both user behavior and attitudes• Design and analyze surveys and/or work with quantitative researchers to design and analyze surveys that address user preferences and attitudes• Work with recruiting team to detail specifications of studies to recruit users to participate in research• Generate insights that both fuel ideation and evaluate designs• Host share-outs of research findings, collecting feedback from stakeholders, and ensure insights are acted on by tracking design and feature changes over time• Communicate results and visualize suggestions clearly and effectively ', 'Company Industry:']

['', 'Partner with designers throughout the discovery and development process to craft elegant and innovative UI solutions.', 'User Researcher: Search & Discovery\xa0', 'As a core member of the JSTOR Search & Discovery product teams, work daily with engineers, designers, product managers, and analysts to prioritize and execute research opportunities in a fast-paced changing environment.', 'Experience with a varied set of research methods including user interview, survey, prototype testing, A/B, and ethnography.\xa0', '\xa0', 'Work for ITHAKA', 'Ann Arbor, MI', '\xa0We are committed to our organizational values of belonging, evidence, speed, teamwork, and trust.', 'Familiarity with common online research and survey tools such as: Optimal Workshop, Qualtrics, and Ethnio.', 'Our team is passionate about our mission and supporting one another.\xa0 We enjoy working together to create opportunities for people to learn and grow out in the world, and we bring that same commitment to helping our teammates develop in our careers and our lives.\xa0 One of our core values is belonging. We embrace differences, and believe that the things that make each of us unique are the things that help us see new insights and build better solutions.\xa0', 'JSTOR makes knowledge accessible to millions of users globally. Come help ITHAKA expand our mission and be part of a team dedicated to crafting delightful experiences and providing affordable access to academic journals, books, images, and primary sources to researchers in 170 countries.\xa0\xa0', 'Evidence is one of our core organizational values, and this role is crucial in enabling us to utilize data to drive decisions. The User Researcher’s role is to inform, develop, and execute a variety of search focused research activities. Working collaboratively with stakeholders and team members you will generate research findings that bring new functions, features, and products to life. As a User Researcher, you will craft research approaches and analyses that inform the search offerings of JSTOR and Artstor, platforms that make academic journals, books, documents, and images available to millions of learners around the world.\xa0', 'Responsibilities', 'Excellent problem-solving skills with an ability to analyze situations, identify existing or potential problems and recommend solutions.', 'Interested candidates can submit their resume, a detailed cover letter, and salary requirements.', 'Stay up-to-date on leading industry literature on search and ongoing developments in the UX research field; actively suggest solutions that leverage improvements from both areas.', 'Experience in an Agile environment is desirable.', 'Ability to identify when an opportunity can best be understood with qualitative or quantitative data.', 'Outstanding analytical and strategic thinking skills.', 'Ability to drive all aspects of research from planning to execution and communicating insights with a multidisciplinary audience.', 'Experience and Skills', 'Foster research and discovery skill growth within the Search & Discovery product teams.\xa0', 'Familiarity with academic search literature, standards, and user expectations a plus.\xa0', 'Ability to multitask and manage several projects simultaneously.', 'Mid-Senior Level', 'As part of the User Insights team, you will partner with researchers and analysts to enhance organizational knowledge of the existing and future JSTOR user base. This team provides information that leads to deeply engaging and delightful products. This role works extensively with Product Managers, Product Designers, and Developers within Discovery teams to test and validate new and existing product concepts. The User Researcher guides teams to define research goals, choose appropriate methodologies, plan, execute, and evaluate research studies.\xa0', 'Partner with product teams in crafting UX experiences and relevancy results which are deeply rooted in the understanding of user needs and expectations.', 'Partner with product teams in crafting UX experiences and relevancy results which are deeply rooted in the understanding of user needs and expectations.Craft and execute research to validate various product hypotheses, leveraging your broad toolkit of methods including: in-depth interview, survey, prototype testing, usability, observational, A/B, card sort, click test, etc.Partner with designers throughout the discovery and development process to craft elegant and innovative UI solutions.As a core member of the JSTOR Search & Discovery product teams, work daily with engineers, designers, product managers, and analysts to prioritize and execute research opportunities in a fast-paced changing environment.Foster research and discovery skill growth within the Search & Discovery product teams.\xa0Stay up-to-date on leading industry literature on search and ongoing developments in the UX research field; actively suggest solutions that leverage improvements from both areas.', 'We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.\xa0 All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, religion, domestic violence victim status, veteran status, disability, history of disability or perceived disability, or other status protected by law.\xa0', '5 plus years of hands-on experience in user-centered research and evaluation.', 'Craft and execute research to validate various product hypotheses, leveraging your broad toolkit of methods including: in-depth interview, survey, prototype testing, usability, observational, A/B, card sort, click test, etc.', 'Are you passionate about infusing the user’s voice to craft meaningful solutions? Do you have a research toolkit busting at the seams? Are you a collaborative researcher who loves to be part of the team generating hypotheses and tailoring research to inform innovative solutions? We are looking for an energetic self-starter to help us level up our search and discovery experiences.\xa0\xa0', 'ITHAKA’s products host a variety of content types, from research articles to images, covering a range of topics, including science, history, and literature. Moreover, our diverse audiences of students and faculty have diverse expectations of search. As a User Researcher, you will help us overcome these challenges by helping the search teams translate user behaviors and needs into actionable and measurable solutions.\xa0', 'Advanced degree in Social Sciences, HCI, or related field.', 'Advanced degree in Social Sciences, HCI, or related field.5 plus years of hands-on experience in user-centered research and evaluation.Ability to use quantitative data (e.g. usage logs and A/B tests) to generate qualitative understanding of user needs and behaviors and vice versa.Experience with a varied set of research methods including user interview, survey, prototype testing, A/B, and ethnography.\xa0Ability to identify when an opportunity can best be understood with qualitative or quantitative data.Familiarity with common online research and survey tools such as: Optimal Workshop, Qualtrics, and Ethnio.Ability to drive all aspects of research from planning to execution and communicating insights with a multidisciplinary audience.Excellent problem-solving skills with an ability to analyze situations, identify existing or potential problems and recommend solutions.Outstanding analytical and strategic thinking skills.Ability to multitask and manage several projects simultaneously.Familiarity with academic search literature, standards, and user expectations a plus.\xa0Experience in an Agile environment is desirable.', 'Apply Now:', 'The Role', 'Learn more about Working at ITHAKA.', 'Ability to use quantitative data (e.g. usage logs and A/B tests) to generate qualitative understanding of user needs and behaviors and vice versa.']

['', '•\tA certain degree of flexibility in job role and working hours during critical deliveries.', '•\tHave a solid understanding of data flow models, technologies and methods.\xa0', '•\tDesign queries to extract specific data from relational and non-relational data sources into data warehouse.\xa0Establish controls to ensure the accuracy and consistency of data.', '•\tStrong analytical skills.', '•\tCoordinate activities with data owners to ensure integration within data warehouse and data integrity issues are addressed', 'Duties and responsibilities\xa0\xa0', '•\tBachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.\xa0', '•\tExtensive work with data from disparate data sources (DB2, Oracle, SQL Server, APIs, flat files, etc.) and load into ODS and Data Warehouse.', '•\tResearch new opportunities for data acquisition', '•\tAnalyze requirements and determine level of effort.', 'SSIS, ETL, SQL Server is a must.\xa0Everything beyond is fine as long as they can enter and push data they are ok.\xa0\xa0', '•\tAbility to handle multiple project assignments concurrently, provide production support when needed, and deliver on commitments.', '•\tProvide ongoing support of enterprise data warehouse, continued development and enhancement of the data warehouse, automation of daily data extracts and external system feeds, and development and enhancement of ETL processes.', '•\tVery strong technical knowledge in ETL tools (SQL Server SSIS, replication, etc.), Databases (SQL Server 2012 & 2014, Oracle and AS400)', 'Ideal candidate is an experienced Data professional to work closely with Business teams, DBAs and Data Warehouse team to design and build database structures based on the data storage and retrieval needs. The Data Architect will be responsible for constantly monitoring our database and immediately addressing data quality issues and problems. Data architect is also expected to have a deep understanding of Machine Learning concepts and be able to supply data needed or make suggestions to improve such systems. The successful candidate will also submit reports to management that outline the changing data needs of the company and come up with related solutions.', 'We have an immediate opening for a Data Architect.\xa0This is a new perm opening for the Highland Park office and can be partial remote once Covid restriction is lifted. For the rest of this year you will work remote.\xa0After they are back in the office you will have the option to work remote a few days a week depending on performance.\xa0\xa0You can start as 7 am or as late as 9:30 as long as they are getting their hours in.\xa0The director is very flexible with the start time. Their Data Warehouse is in SQL Server and AWS.\xa0More of an advanced, data planning, and database design person. You need to be able to interact with the data science team.\xa0A high Level ETL developer would be fine, but not a data scientist.\xa0\xa0Salary up to 130K, plus bonus, 401K and profit sharing.\xa0', '•\tExcellent organizational, verbal and written communication skills.\xa0', '•\tDesign ETL architecture including CDC, mappings, data flows, procedures, schedules, etc.', 'Qualifications required\xa0', '•\tHigh proficiency in understanding relational and dimensional data models', '•\tPerformance tuning the existing ETL processes and procedures.\xa0', '•\tHas good knowledge of standard methodologies, concepts, best practices, and procedures within a Business Intelligence environment.']

company: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
job_text: ['', 'Required at least 3 years of postdoctoral experience in a research laboratory.', 'Proficiency with flow cytometry, molecular biology, immunology and mouse models of multiple sclerosis', 'An analytical mindset with organizational and problem-solving skills', 'Supervise other personnel in the laboratory to coordinate research efforts for increased efficiency;\xa0participate in training of fellows, residents, students and volunteer workers as needed. Oversee media preparation, animal maintenance and equipment maintenance;\xa0quality control analysis of reagents.', 'Experience with CRISPR preferred', 'Responsibilities:', 'A position at the Ntranos Lab at Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai is available for an experienced, inquisitive and talented individual who is interested in conducting cutting edge translational research at the interface of neurology and immunology as a senior Postdoctoral Researcher.', 'Excellent work-ethic and communication and interpersonal skills', 'Compensation commensurate with experience', 'Search pertinent scientific literature as needed.', 'MD and/or PhD in basic science or relevant field', 'Design and conduct experiments independently; design and adapt new procedures, methods or instrumentation relative to research procedures.', 'The appointed senior Postdoctoral Researcher will be immersed in an innovative, collaborative and productive environment at the Ntranos Lab at Mount Sinai, located in the upper east side of New York City.\xa0Functioning independently, the Postdoctoral Researcher will design, organize and conduct highly specialized and advanced experiments using established scientific protocols and procedures and in some cases designing new protocols; summarize findings and publish results in research journals; assume general responsibility for scientific operations of the laboratory; provide supervision and guidance to junior technicians, students, and researchers.', 'Job requirements:', 'MD and/or PhD in basic science or relevant fieldRequired at least 3 years of postdoctoral experience in a research laboratory.Proficiency with flow cytometry, molecular biology, immunology and mouse models of multiple sclerosisExperience with CRISPR preferredAn analytical mindset with organizational and problem-solving skillsExcellent work-ethic and communication and interpersonal skills', 'Design and conduct experiments independently; design and adapt new procedures, methods or instrumentation relative to research procedures.Supervise other personnel in the laboratory to coordinate research efforts for increased efficiency;\xa0participate in training of fellows, residents, students and volunteer workers as needed. Oversee media preparation, animal maintenance and equipment maintenance;\xa0quality control analysis of reagents.Collect, prepare and analyze research data;\xa0keep a detailed notebook summarizing experiments and recording research data;\xa0maintain computer database of research data;\xa0tabulate and display data for presentation in research conferences and for manuscript preparation;\xa0use graphics and statistical software to analyze and present data.Search pertinent scientific literature as needed.', 'The Ntranos Lab studies the mechanisms through which the immune system contributes to autoimmune diseases of the brain and spinal cord, such as multiple sclerosis, and is developing novel treatment strategies to stop disease in each individual patient. Our research integrates patient-derived single-cell level data with mouse models of disease to establish causation rather than correlation and develop the next generation of therapeutics and discover novel biomarkers. ', 'Collect, prepare and analyze research data;\xa0keep a detailed notebook summarizing experiments and recording research data;\xa0maintain computer database of research data;\xa0tabulate and display data for presentation in research conferences and for manuscript preparation;\xa0use graphics and statistical software to analyze and present data.']

['', 'Assen Marintchev, Ph.D.', '\tInterested candidates should send via email a Cover letter, CV, and the names and contact information of two references to Assen Marintchev at amarint@bu.edu. Please include "Postdoctoral Position" in the subject line.', 'Boston, MA 02118', 'email: amarint@bu.edu', 'Postdoctoral Position', 'Boston, Massachusetts', 'http://www.bumc.bu.edu/phys-biophys/profile/assen-marintchev/', 'Tel.: (617) 358-8486', '\tA postdoctoral position is available in the laboratory of Assen Marintchev at the Boston University School of Medicine, Department of Physiology and Biophysics (http://www.bumc.bu.edu/phys-biophys/profile/assen-marintchev/) to study the regulation of eukaryotic translation initiation and the Integrated Stress Response (ISR). ', '\tThe candidates must have strong background in Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, or Structural Biology. Research experience in translation, NMR, or quantitative analysis of protein-protein interactions is a plus. Creative, independent candidates who enjoy working in a collaborative environment are encouraged to apply. The start date is flexible. The position is with competitive salary and full benefits.', 'Boston University School of Medicine', '                                 Translation Initiation and ISR', 'Dept. of Physiology & Biophysics', '700 Albany St., W336']

['The Departments of Electrical Engineering and Physics at The Pennsylvania State University are seeking to fill one postdoctoral position under the direction of Dr. Morteza Kayyalha and Dr. Nitin Samarth. The postdoc will work on exploring the fundamental properties of 2D materials Josephson junctions. The topics include emergent phenomena in superlattice heterostructures and superconducting proximity effect.', 'This is a fixed-term appointment funded for one year from date of hire with possibility of renewal for an additional year.', 'Requirements include a Ph.D. in Physics, Electrical Engineering, or other relevant fields. Successful candidates are expected to have expertise in nanoscale device fabrication and low temperature electrical/superconducting transport measurements. Experiences with 2D materials-based van der Waals heterostructures, Josephson junctions, and supercondutors are highly desired. The postdoc will mentor graduate and undergraduate students and will be guided to enhance his/her writing and research credentials through grant writing and peer reviewed publications.']

[' • Assist with ongoing monitoring of safety data and regular medical review of clinical trial data.', ' • Remains up-to-date with current information on pharmaceutical regulations, guidelines, and practices and therapeutic area knowledge and ensures consistent best practice across all activities.', 'Candidates must have an advanced degree (PhD, MD, PharmD) and industry experience in clinical development – at least 2 years.', ' • Supports the GDTL/GCDL to provide expert scientific clinical development advice and leadership to the project teams for the development of Phase I-IV clinical programs.', ' • Assist in the review, analysis and reporting of clinical trial data', ' • Experience in submissions of IND/CTX/NDA/MAA and interactions with Regulatory authorities, and /or', ' • Supports the GDTL or GCDL when participating in marketing and clinical/medical advisory panels, steering committees and investigator meetings.', ' • Experience in designing and conducting Phase II-III clinical trials; Good analytical skills and the ability to review emerging data from clinical studies.', ' • Significant experience (5+ years) of clinical research and organizational management within the pharmaceutical industry, a CRO or similar organization.', ' • Collaborates with Global Development Team Lead, and Global Clinical Team Lead, to ensure that all development and product support activities for the assigned projects are coordinated and consistent;', ' • Demonstrated ability to collaborate in a matrixed environment', ' • Availability to participate in early or late meetings/teleconferences', ' • Serve as a scientific resource to cross-functional internal teams to facilitate quality of study execution and problem resolution (Director)', ' 1. job_title: Scientist I – Single cell computational biology
job_text: ['', ' A write-up of different computational methods tested and their reasons for rejection or adoption. ', ' Position Type ', ' Adapt novel statistical algorithms as needed to extend analysis. ', ' Strong statistical background. ', ' This role is currently working remotely due to COVID-19 and our focus on employee safety. We continue to evaluate the safest options for our employees. As restrictions are lifted in relation to COVID-19, this role may return to work onsite. ', ' Experience analyzing high-throughput transcriptomics or epigenetics data. ', '  A write-up of different computational methods tested and their reasons for rejection or adoption.   A statistical toolbox of adopted methods that can be easily applied to any transcriptomic- or epigenomic-based classification generated as part of the BICCN.   Presentations to international cell type communities with the goal of broad cross-consortium support.  ', '  Identify, apply, and compare existing computational tools for quantitative definition of transcriptomic-based cell types, including metrics that statistically quantify existence and class variation. ['In addition, the general lab environment is collaborative, friendly, and constructive. We are seeking highly motivated and productive scientists with suitable background as aforementioned. The laboratory nurtures a collaborative environment with ample opportunities for grant writing, professional training, and career development routes. The laboratory is highly multidisciplinary and scientific integrated. For all positions, salary is commensurate with experience, and full-scale state employee benefits will be provided. College Station is a great place to live, offering small town environment near to the major cities. If you are interested in such a position, please don’t hesitate to contact Dr. Susie Dai at sydai@tamu.edu or Joshua Yuan, Professor and Chair of Synthetic Biology and Renewable Products, syuan@tamu.edu. ', 'A postdoc position is available at Texas A&M University Systems and Synthetic Hub immediately. ', 'The postdoc position focuses on environmental remediation researches using various state-of-art platforms including material engineering and systems biology and synthetics biology tools (genomics, proteomics and metabolomics platforms). The ideal candidate will study various environmental contaminants and develop novel bio-based materials for bioremediation. This is a joint position among two labs and the Synthetic and Systems Biology Innovation Hub. The candidate will engage broad collaborations and work with other disciplines including renewable energy, material science, environmental engineering, and public health.\xa0The position is expected to engineer new renewable materials and study environmental toxins using various techniques and platforms. Background in material engineering, chemical or electro catalysis, chemistry, biochemistry and/or analytical chemistry, in particular, with hand-on experience on material engineering and characterization is preferred. ', '\xa0']

job_title: Sr. Distributed Systems Research Scientist/Engineer, Software
job_text: ['', 'We have a collaborative and inclusive environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers. Our culture embraces transparency, learning, and fun. We offer an attractive compensation package consisting of competitive salary, benefits, vacation bonuses, and equity participation.', 'Create and execute long-term strategic research activities', 'Actively interface with research project sponsors, customers, research partners, and prospects', 'We are seeking a Senior Distributed Systems Research Engineer. This is a unique opportunity to join our truly unique research team. Unlike many other corporate research departments, RTI’s team works closely with product development and field teams. As a result, we are rated in the top 1% in the country for research commercialization success. Like other top teams, we are creative, we take risk, we drive innovation, and we communicate openly. But then our product and field teams drive our top results into the real world. Most academic and corporate research dies in the lab; yours will not at RTI.\xa0', 'Support the transition of promising technical innovations to product including customer trials, coordinating with product management, design, development, testing and support groups', 'Communicate technical innovations through papers and presentations', 'Requirements', 'Experience using OMG Data-Distribution Service (DDS) middleware, such as through RTI’s University Program, is a great plus, but not required.', 'RTI is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color national origin, sex, age status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.', 'PhD in Computer Science/Engineering, Robotics, Autonomy, Smart Machines, Distributed Systems or related field.', 'You will be part of a team of experts researching emerging technologies, solving problems posed by our research sponsors, exploring new concepts for products, prototyping ideas, and advancing RTI’s secure real-time middleware platform. This is an individual contributor role; we want you to develop a reputation and research program that sets you apart as an industry leader. Duties will include:', 'In the next ten years, cars will safely drive themselves, hospitals will automatically care for patients, defense systems will protect with lower cost and error, and power systems will better use renewables. Real-Time Innovations (RTI) is the world’s\xa0number one\xa0software framework for these smart machines and real-world systems. We lead the transition to intelligent, autonomous systems, the most important technology trend for the next decade and beyond.\xa0\xa0', 'Solid programming skills (e.g. C/C++, Java, scripting languages)', 'U.S. citizenship required. Work to be performed for this position relates to federal government contracts which require U.S. citizenship.', 'Responsibilities', 'Ability to work successfully / actively engage with a highly distributed team', '\xa0number one', 'Innovate new solutions that will form the foundation of secure, adaptable, and fast distributed systemsCreate and execute long-term strategic research activitiesWork with the business development team to define research areas of interest and define interesting research proposal topicsExecute and lead research contracts to push our technology forward. Serve in the role of Principal Investigator on externally-funded research projects.Actively interface with research project sponsors, customers, research partners, and prospectsParticipate in and drive industry standardsCommunicate technical innovations through papers and presentationsSupport the transition of promising technical innovations to product including customer trials, coordinating with product management, design, development, testing and support groups', 'PhD in Computer Science/Engineering, Robotics, Autonomy, Smart Machines, Distributed Systems or related field.New graduates are welcome; some experience preferred.Experience in distributed systems researchExcellent written communications skills, and evidence of research publicationsIdeally, experience writing and winning proposals, and research project managementSolid understanding of networks, system programming, real-time, machine control, and/or high-performance applicationsSolid programming skills (e.g. C/C++, Java, scripting languages)Ability to work successfully / actively engage with a highly distributed teamExperience using OMG Data-Distribution Service (DDS) middleware, such as through RTI’s University Program, is a great plus, but not required.U.S. citizenship required. Work to be performed for this position relates to federal government contracts which require U.S. citizenship.', 'Solid understanding of networks, system programming, real-time, machine control, and/or high-performance applications', 'About RTI', 'The research team’s mission is to maintain our status as the most advanced infrastructure in the industry.\xa0Our software implements direct peer-to-peer connections, reliable multicast, automated application discovery, and unique, contractual quality-of-service control. Our research seeks to push advances in today’s greatest challenges, including advanced compression, machine learning, edge processing, software-defined networking, hardware and software cybersecurity, resiliency, simulation and gaming engines, fault tolerance, microkernels, safety, and software verification. RTI Research is highly regarded; our excellent record helps us win millions of dollars in funding per year.', 'As a company, RTI is also unique. Our diverse and global workforce believes in working hard and enjoying the journey. We recognize employees for their achievements, offer great opportunities for career growth and development, and provide the tools they need to succeed. We also offer great compensation, benefits, and flexibility. RTI commits to making your life as satisfying as your career. RTI’s collaborative, transparent, and creative\xa0culture\xa0truly sets us apart from the rest.', 'Experience in distributed systems research', 'Execute and lead research contracts to push our technology forward. Serve in the role of Principal Investigator on externally-funded research projects.', 'RTI is distributed!\xa0This position can be located at our new office near Denver, Colorado, at headquarters in Sunnyvale, California, or at your home nationwide.', 'Ideally, experience writing and winning proposals, and research project management', 'Our ambitious mission and amazing opportunity is to transform transportation, medicine, power, defense, and control. Our\xa0core values\xa0emphasize excellence, teamwork, and your potential. Few small companies can truly claim to make the world run\xa0better\xa0like RTI. Come help.', 'New graduates are welcome; some experience preferred.', 'Job Location', 'Excellent written communications skills, and evidence of research publications', 'Work with the business development team to define research areas of interest and define interesting research proposal topics', 'Our software runs the largest power plants on the continent, connects perception to control in over 200 autonomous vehicles, drives the new generation of medical robotics, controls hyperloop and flying cars, and provides 24x7 medical intelligence to hospital patients and emergency victims. We are the best positioned company in the world to create the future of smart distributed systems. There is no better place to usher in the new intelligent world.\xa0', 'Innovate new solutions that will form the foundation of secure, adaptable, and fast distributed systems', 'Participate in and drive industry standards']

['', 'Open Post-doctoral fellow position in Neuroscience', '\tPlease send CV, application letter with goals and motivation (max. 2 pages) and names of three references as a single pdf file to Dr Deak (fdeak@augusta.edu). If you have reference letters in hand, please send copies of those, too. ', '\tImportantly, you have to apply online at https://www.augusta.edu/hr/jobs/university/ for job opening #218990 to be considered as an applicant. Evaluation of candidates will start on September 2nd, 2020 and continue until position is filled.', '\tWe are inviting talented researchers with PhD or MD degree to apply as post-doctoral fellows to our NIH funded laboratory at the Dept. Neuroscience &Regenerative Medicine of Augusta University in the historic town of Augusta, GA. Main focus of the research in the laboratory of Dr. Deak is cognitive impairment with aging and various neurological disorders, for instance Alzheimer’s disease and epileptic encephalopathy. State-of-the-art methods are used to develop new models of these disorders and to study possible new therapeutic targets from the molecular to cellular and neuronal network levels. Best approaches are validated in behavioral assays using transgenic rodent models. We are a well established team with multiple collaborations both locally and inter/nationally. Expertise in electrophysiology is preferred.']

job_title: Sr UX Researcher - Kiewit Technology Group
job_text: ['', ' Leads user pool, discussion guide, and report creation for moderated and unmoderated UX research in the lab or the field, qualitative or quantitative, and behavioral or attitudinal. (Surveys, contextual and stakeholder interviews, usability testing, card sorts, tree tests, sketching exercises, and other appropriate methods.)', ' Organizes and leads participatory discovery, ideation, and design activities in consultations, workshops, labs, or focus groups of various sizes leading to meaningful decisions, ideas, or artifacts.', ' Work with UI Designers and Developers to bring concepts to life while maintaining UX best practices.', 'Requisition ID: 105479 ', ' Demonstrated UX/Design Thinking facilitation skills such as Design Sprints or Workshops.', 'Market: Corporate Home Office ', ' Willingness to travel approximately less than 10%.', ' Trains, advocates, and mentors teams and collaborators on user centered design, the UX/UI team vision, and new and better ways to execute.', ' Produces and documents appropriate UX deliverables such as service blueprints, process diagrams, personas, empathy maps, prioritization grids, wireframes, site maps, user flows, and research analysis reports.', ' 3 years of UX Design experience Degree in Human Computer Interaction (HCI), User Experience Design or equivalent professional training / experience. Demonstrated mastery of User Centered Design (UCD) and creation of UX deliverables (site maps, user flows, personas, surveys, and research analysis reports) required. Demonstrated UX/Design Thinking facilitation skills such as Design Sprints or Workshops. Ability to synthesize and articulate complex concepts targeted at multiple audiences. Experience in enterprise-wide product solutions required. Effectively communicates verbal, written, and designed content. Demonstrated leadership abilities on projects and teams. Willingness to travel approximately less than 10%.', ' Degree in Human Computer Interaction (HCI), User Experience Design or equivalent professional training / experience.', 'Responsibilities', ' 3 years of UX Design experience', ' Effectively communicates verbal, written, and designed content.', 'We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.', ' Ability to synthesize and articulate complex concepts targeted at multiple audiences.', 'Employment Type: Full Time ', ' Demonstrated leadership abilities on projects and teams.', 'District Overview', ' Teaches and surfaces relevant secondary research from usability white papers, human factors, and the psychology of design when providing guidance, feedback, and heuristic evaluations.', ' Advocates, implements, and executes effective user-centric research and design processes aligned to user goals, business needs, and technical requirements. Leads user pool, discussion guide, and report creation for moderated and unmoderated UX research in the lab or the field, qualitative or quantitative, and behavioral or attitudinal. (Surveys, contextual and stakeholder interviews, usability testing, card sorts, tree tests, sketching exercises, and other appropriate methods.) Produces and documents appropriate UX deliverables such as service blueprints, process diagrams, personas, empathy maps, prioritization grids, wireframes, site maps, user flows, and research analysis reports. Organizes and leads participatory discovery, ideation, and design activities in consultations, workshops, labs, or focus groups of various sizes leading to meaningful decisions, ideas, or artifacts. Helps articulate product KPIs and facilitates activities to report relevant and actionable analytics and measurements. Work with UI Designers and Developers to bring concepts to life while maintaining UX best practices. Teaches and surfaces relevant secondary research from usability white papers, human factors, and the psychology of design when providing guidance, feedback, and heuristic evaluations. Trains, advocates, and mentors teams and collaborators on user centered design, the UX/UI team vision, and new and better ways to execute.', ' Demonstrated mastery of User Centered Design (UCD) and creation of UX deliverables (site maps, user flows, personas, surveys, and research analysis reports) required.', ' Advocates, implements, and executes effective user-centric research and design processes aligned to user goals, business needs, and technical requirements.', ' Experience in enterprise-wide product solutions required.', ' Helps articulate product KPIs and facilitates activities to report relevant and actionable analytics and measurements.', 'Location', 'Qualifications', 'Department: Information Technology ', 'Job Level: Senior Level ', 'Position Overview']

job_text: ['', 'Able to multitask and be a great teammate', 'Basic Qualifications', 'Expertise with R and/or Python', 'Use models to address key growth challenges and provide relevant insights on problems such as cross-channel optimization, market/individual level response modeling, targeting optimization, propensity modeling, uplift modeling, etc', 'Hunger and drive to learn complex topics', 'Work with cross-functional teams to implement and deploy models and improve analytical solutions by providing data-driven recommendations', 'Relevant work experience in applying advanced analytics or data science to marketing problems', 'Build tools and products that will optimize each part of the marketing funnel (from prospecting to sign up to early user to active user and churn), as well as to support budget planning, measurement, attribution, targeting, cross-sell/up-sell, paid channel optimization, and segmentation for core Uber businesses globally', '3+ years of working experience as a data scientistRelevant work experience in applying advanced analytics or data science to marketing problemsPrevious experience in advertising tech (e.g. market response modeling, forecasting, attribution, targeting, 3rd party data integration, and etc) is a plusExperience with big data using technologies like Hadoop, Hive, and Spark a plusStrong communication skillsOrganized and have the ability to balance attention to detail with swift executionAble to multitask and be a great teammateHunger and drive to learn complex topicsPassion for Uber!', 'Minimum 1 year of working experience as a data scientistExpertise with R and/or PythonAdvanced SQL skills - comfortable working with very large data setsExperience with machine learning techniques and advanced analytics (e.g. regression, classification, clustering, time series, econometrics, causal inference, mathematical optimization)', "What You'll Do", 'Use large scale data processing such as Spark, Hive, and Uber’s proprietary machine learning platform, and more', '3+ years of working experience as a data scientist', 'Build production grade models on large-scale datasets to optimize marketing performance by utilizing advanced statistical modeling, machine learning, or data mining techniques and marketing science research', 'Build production grade models on large-scale datasets to optimize marketing performance by utilizing advanced statistical modeling, machine learning, or data mining techniques and marketing science researchUse models to address key growth challenges and provide relevant insights on problems such as cross-channel optimization, market/individual level response modeling, targeting optimization, propensity modeling, uplift modeling, etcWork with cross-functional teams to implement and deploy models and improve analytical solutions by providing data-driven recommendationsUse large scale data processing such as Spark, Hive, and Uber’s proprietary machine learning platform, and moreCollaborate with marketing leadership, design, product and engineering teamsParticipate in project planning/prioritization meetings, partner meetings, data prioritization meetings, etcBuild tools and products that will optimize each part of the marketing funnel (from prospecting to sign up to early user to active user and churn), as well as to support budget planning, measurement, attribution, targeting, cross-sell/up-sell, paid channel optimization, and segmentation for core Uber businesses globally', 'Organized and have the ability to balance attention to detail with swift execution', 'Advanced SQL skills - comfortable working with very large data sets', 'Experience with big data using technologies like Hadoop, Hive, and Spark a plus', 'About The Role', 'Experience with machine learning techniques and advanced analytics (e.g. regression, classification, clustering, time series, econometrics, causal inference, mathematical optimization)', 'Previous experience in advertising tech (e.g. market response modeling, forecasting, attribution, targeting, 3rd party data integration, and etc) is a plus', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Passion for Uber!', 'Minimum 1 year of working experience as a data scientist', 'Participate in project planning/prioritization meetings, partner meetings, data prioritization meetings, etc', 'Strong communication skills', 'Collaborate with marketing leadership, design, product and engineering teams']

job_title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer / Data Scientist, Machine Assisted Cognition
job_text: ['Our work is guided by a dedication to safety – in both what we research and how we perform our research our goal is to benefit society. As a subsidiary of Toyota, TRI is fueled by a diverse and inclusive community of people who carry invaluable leadership, experience, and ideas from industry-leading companies. Over half of our technical team carries PhD degrees. We’re continually searching for the world’s best talent ‒ people who are ready to define the new world of mobility with us! ', 'Experience architecting and deploying machine learning systems in an industry setting. ', 'Pushing the boundaries of AIs that can reason (causally informed AI) ', 'Collaborate cross-functionally with machine learning and causal inference experts, designers, behavioral scientists, user researchers, and university partners to design and build novel AIs to augment human decision making. Some potential research and development areas may include: ', 'Responsibilities:', 'We strive to build a company that helps our people thrive, achieve work-life balance, and bring their best selves to work. At TRI, you will have the opportunity to enjoy the best of both worlds ‒ a fun environment with forward-thinking people who enjoy solving tough problems and the financial backing to successfully achieve our goals. Come work with TRI if you’re interested in transforming mobility through designing technology for safer cars, enabling the elderly to age in place, or designing alternative fuel sources. Start your impossible with us. ', 'Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Chemistry). Ph.D. preferred. Deep expertise in machine learning and deep learning. Proficiency in causal inference and advanced statistics. Experience architecting and deploying machine learning systems in an industry setting. Experience in providing technical leadership and mentorship. Strong track record of driving and executing complex, open-ended, cross-functional projects. Strong interpersonal skills. Great teammate. Appetite to learn across functions.', 'Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative field (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, Chemistry). Ph.D. preferred. ', '- Bring advanced mobility technology to market faster. ', 'TRI’s Machine Assisted Cognition team is developing AI systems to augment (not replace) human decision making. In particular, we are interested in advancing the intersection between machine learning, causal inference, and behavioral science to increase the quality of human decisions and/or to facilitate faster innovation cycles. We are looking for a Senior or Staff Machine Learning Engineer / Data Scientist to join this exciting new endeavor to collaborate cross-functionally with machine learning and causal inference experts, behavioral scientists, designers, and user researchers. ', 'Strong track record of driving and executing complex, open-ended, cross-functional projects. ', 'Scaling up to more complex cognitive tasks and larger groups while countering the tendency of groups to be risk-averse. ', 'Strong interpersonal skills. Great teammate. ', '- Discover new materials that will make batteries and hydrogen fuel cells smaller, lighter, less expensive and more powerful. ', 'Qualifications: ', '- Develop technology for vehicles and robots to help people enjoy new levels of independence, access, and mobility. ', 'Experience in providing technical leadership and mentorship. ', 'At Toyota Research Institute (TRI), we’re working to build a future where everyone has the freedom to move, engage, and explore with a focus on reducing vehicle collisions, injuries, and fatalities. Join us in our mission to improve the quality of human life through advances in artificial intelligence, automated driving, robotics, and materials science. We’re dedicated to building a world of “mobility for all” where everyone, regardless of age or ability, can live in harmony with technology to enjoy a better life. Through innovations in AI, we’ll help… ', 'Appetite to learn across functions.', 'Responsibilities: ', ' ', 'Proficiency in causal inference and advanced statistics. ', 'Deep expertise in machine learning and deep learning. ', 'Collaborate cross-functionally with machine learning and causal inference experts, designers, behavioral scientists, user researchers, and university partners to design and build novel AIs to augment human decision making. Some potential research and development areas may include: Pushing the boundaries of AIs that can reason (causally informed AI) Increasing quality of predictions, judgments, and decisions by (a) reducing/neutralizing cognitive biases, (b) ensuring fitness, (c) ensuring ethics Scaling up to more complex cognitive tasks and larger groups while countering the tendency of groups to be risk-averse. Mentor and advise others. ', '- Develop vehicles incapable of causing a crash, regardless of the actions of the driver. ', 'Increasing quality of predictions, judgments, and decisions by (a) reducing/neutralizing cognitive biases, (b) ensuring fitness, (c) ensuring ethics ', 'Mentor and advise others. ', '- Develop human-centered AI systems to augment (not replace) human decision making to increase the quality of decisions (e.g. mitigate cognitive biases) and/or to facilitate faster innovation cycles. ', 'Qualifications:']

['', ' Experience with different qualitative research methods including 1:1 interviews, concept testing, ethnographic-style fieldwork, group discussions, card sorting, workshops, and a special emphasis on adapting these traditional methods to the requirements of remote work during a time when travel and face to face encounters might be challenging or impossible . * ', '  Work closely with customers through novel approach es to user research that are effective even in a world where travel is challenging, and social distancing is still imperative.   Working \u202f closely \u202f with our teammates in \u202f Sweden and Canada \u202f  ', '  Experience with an agile approach to adapting and improving on research practices to meet team needs under the tight timeframes of a growing company  ', 'What You’ll Be Doing', ' Working \u202f closely \u202f with our teammates in \u202f Sweden and Canada \u202f ', ' Working with our \u202f data and sales \u202f teams to help bring \u202f user insights to bear on our \u202f design strategy \u202f \u202f ', 'Senior UX Researcher', ' Experience in a variety of product spaces, applied research and/or academic settings - from exploratory research to market research surveys to usability studies ', "  5+ years of experience leading research projects in a professional environment   A strong portfolio that demonstrates your research skill and the impact your work has had on the enterprise products you’ve worked on   Bachelor's degree in Anthropology, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Human Factors, Psychology, Sociology, or a related field or equivalent practical experience   Experience in a variety of product spaces, applied research and/or academic settings - from exploratory research to market research surveys to usability studies  ", ' Self-starter and can navigate through ambiguous research problems. You can synthesize and translate qualitative and quantitative data into actionable insights and the identification of real opportunities ', '  Experience with different qualitative research methods including 1:1 interviews, concept testing, ethnographic-style fieldwork, group discussions, card sorting, workshops, and a special emphasis on adapting these traditional methods to the requirements of remote work during a time when travel and face to face encounters might be challenging or impossible . *   Strong understanding of the strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply them during the product development process   Self-starter and can navigate through ambiguous research problems. You can synthesize and translate qualitative and quantitative data into actionable insights and the identification of real opportunities   Proficiency in communicating user research findings with cross functional partners to drive impact  ', ' Strong understanding of the strengths and shortcomings of different research methods, including when and how to apply them during the product development process ', " Bachelor's degree in Anthropology, Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), Human Factors, Psychology, Sociology, or a related field or equivalent practical experience ", ' Experience with an agile approach to adapting and improving on research practices to meet team needs under the tight timeframes of a growing company ', ' A strong portfolio that demonstrates your research skill and the impact your work has had on the enterprise products you’ve worked on ', '  Working with our \u202f data and sales \u202f teams to help bring \u202f user insights to bear on our \u202f design strategy \u202f \u202f   Working with product owners to help them product strategy and to identify new opportunities informed by real customer data and reports.  ', ' Working with product owners to help them product strategy and to identify new opportunities informed by real customer data and reports. ', ' 5+ years of experience leading research projects in a professional environment ', 'This position does not entail travel in the near term, as long as COVID places restrictions on travel and indoor face to face encounters. As restrictions are lifted, you may expect to travel to customers for on-site visits and meetings, possibly as often as 6 times a year, but only when it becomes safe to do so.\u202f The strongest candidates will have experience in qualitative UX research that can be done remotely.', 'How You’ll Stand Out', ' Work closely with customers through novel approach es to user research that are effective even in a world where travel is challenging, and social distancing is still imperative. ', ' Proficiency in communicating user research findings with cross functional partners to drive impact ']

From accounting clerks and bookkeepers to accounts payable and staff accountants, we can provide you unparalleled access to exciting career opportunities. But don't take our word for it. Our company has appeared on Fortune® magazine’s list of “World's Most Admired Companies” since 1998, and 9 out of 10 of our customers would recommend our service to a colleague.Accountemps, a Robert Half Company, matches highly skilled professionals with accounting finance jobs on a temporary and temporary-to-hire basis. From accounting clerks and bookeepers to accounts payable and staff accountants, we provide you with access to exciting career opportunities. By working with us, you have access to challenging opportunities, competitive compensation and benefits, and training to enhance your skill sets.From philanthropy to environmental stewardship to employee programs, Robert Half is proud to have an active role in the communities in which we live and work. Our company has appeared on FORTUNE’s “Most Admired Companies” list every year since 1998.Download our mobile app to take your job search on the go!Contact your local Accountemps office at 888.490.3195 or visit www.roberthalf.com/jobs/accountemps to apply for this job now or find out more about other job opportunities.All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be authorized to work in the United States.
